Who is Bankim Brahmbhatt? Indian-origin CEO accused of $500m scam at BlackRock
description: BlackRock's private credit arm, HPS Investment Partners, alleges a multi-million-dollar fraud by Bankim Brahmbhatt's telecom firms. Lenders claim Brahmbhatt fabricated receivables used as collateral for over $500 million in loans. Brahmbhatt's companies have filed for bankruptcy, and he is reportedly in India.

title: Watch: Thousands of Haredi Jews protest Israel’s military draft law in Jerusalem
description: Thousands of ultra-Orthodox, or Haredi, Jews took to the streets of Jerusalem in a massive “Million Man March” opposing Israel’s proposed military conscription law. The law would require Haredi men to serve in the army, ending decades of exemption for religious study. Demonstrators filled streets and rooftops, chanting and clashing with police. The protest follows a Supreme Court ruling mandating Haredi enlistment, as political divisions deepen over Israel’s controversial draft reform.

"It was a one-size-fits-all approach, of toppling regimes, trying to impose our system of governance on others, intervene in conflicts that were barely understood and walk away with more enemies than allies."

title: Watch: Cyclone Montha wreaks havoc: 4 million affected across Telugu states
description: Cyclone Montha has wreaked havoc across Telangana and Andhra Pradesh, bringing record-breaking rainfall, floods, and power outages. Over four million people are affected as thousands evacuate from submerged areas. With 13,000 power poles and 3,000 transformers damaged, restoration efforts are ongoing. Officials report at least three deaths and losses exceeding ₹5,265 crore.

description: Assistant Police Inspector Amol Waghmare was forced to shoot an armed kidnapper, Rohit Arryya, who had taken several children hostage in a Powai studio. Arryya doused the premises with petrol and threatened to set it ablaze. Police rescued the children after a tense standoff and Waghmare's decisive action.

title: Vellore Corporation begins desilting of old drains in Netaji market to prevent inundation
description: Corporation officials said that the existing Netaji wholesale market, which is 1.5 acres, has 982 shops including 282 retail outlets.

description: Accordingly, a special police team was conducting a routine check near Walajah railway station when the team found the duo selling the tablets in a dilapidated building.

He highlights the significant progress in J&K cricket, attributing it to opening doors for aspiring players. Rasool also discusses the challenges faced by domestic performers from smaller states and the overshadowing effect of IPL performances over consistent domestic achievements.

title: GCC to widen narrow roads in Chennai to ease traffic congestion
description: Officials say work on end-to-end paving of four roads has been completed in a few congested areas; the widening of the carriageway in certain stretches is expected to ease traffic, they added

description: The case relates to Ajay Kumar, a boxer who has represented India in international competitions and won medals at both national and international levels

title: Kurnool accident: Trapped in a burning bus
description: On the morning of October 24, a sleeper bus caught fire on a national highway, killing 19 passengers and injuring several others. Initial investigations by the Andhra Pradesh police indicate that the bus collided with a motorcycle lying in the middle of the road, which was reportedly driven by a drunken man. Marri Ramu and P. Hareesh report on the tragedy that has also exposed how the private operator of a “luxury bus” failed to adhere to basic safety norms

title: 'Knocking at the door': Suryavanshi set for India call-up? IPL chief hails bench strength
description: IPL Chairman Arun Dhumal lauded India's bench strength and the enduring class of Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli. Dhumal highlighted Rohit's Player of the Series performance against Australia, showcasing his conviction and work ethic, and expressed confidence in their continued contributions to Indian cricket.

title: Patel wanted to merge all of Kashmir with India, Nehru didn’t let him: PM Modi

description: The NDA unveiled its Bihar election manifesto, promising over one crore employment opportunities through skill development and infrastructure projects. The alliance also focused on welfare schemes, including financial aid for women and EBC youth, and pledged to top up PM-KISAN support with an additional annual payout.

description: The 27 revamped narrowbodies will be utilised for as many as 3,024 weekly flights on 82 domestic and short-haul-international routes, the airline said

title: China ships always on radar: Navy vice chief
description: India is closely monitoring Chinese warships and spy vessels in the Indian Ocean Region, with at least 40-50 operating there at any given time. This comes as India prepares to host the 'Milan' maritime exercise and International Fleet Review in Visakhapatnam, featuring navies from the US, Russia, Japan, and Australia, while excluding China and Pakistan.

title: India, US ink new defence framework for 10 yrs; aim to deepen cooperation in all domains
description: India and the US have inked an expansive 10-year defense framework to deepen strategic partnership, aiming to enhance cooperation across all domains. This move signals a renewed commitment to regional stability and safeguarding a free and open Indo-Pacific, despite ongoing trade tensions and shifting US priorities.

title: Even detours are jammed: Secunderabad motorists crawl through narrow, battered bylanes
description: Spillover from Paradise-Dairy Farm Road elevated corridor work turns Secunderabad’s inner roads into a commuter maze

title: Juvenile's conviction is not a bar to govt service, rules Allahabad HC
description: The Allahabad High Court ruled that a conviction under the Juvenile Justice Act does not disqualify individuals from service appointments. This decision came after a Jawahar Navodaya Vidyalaya teacher was dismissed for concealing a childhood offense. The court reinstated the teacher, emphasizing that juvenile convictions should not lead to disqualification.

title: Jharkhand migrant caught in crossfire in Saudi Arabia dies, Govt makes effort to bring back body
description: The youth identified as Vijay Kumar Mahato had been working in a private company as a tower line fitter for the last nine months.

title: Food technologist Vidhya Parshuramkar, 24, wins 4th Rohini Nayyar Prize
description: Ms. Parshuramkar is the first woman and youngest person to win the Rohini Nayyar Prize, given out by the Rohini Nayyar Foundation, to celebrate the pioneering economist’s work in public policy; the award involves a trophy, a cash prize of ₹10 lakh, and a citation

title: Activist seeks probe into ‘fake encounter of Rohit Arya to cover up Government’s failures’
description: Advocate Nitin Satpute demands independent probe into hostage-taker’s death; questions raised over unpaid dues, police conduct, and government accountability.

title: Bihar polls: ‘People have decided to bring change,’ says Tejashwi Yadav | Interview
description: Mahagatbandhan will win as people want that those who talk about education, irrigation, medicine, jobs, and prompt action should form govt., says RJD leader and the Chief Ministerial face of the Opposition bloc; he says JD(U) will cease to exist after the polls as he rules out any tie-up with Nitish

title: Is Joel Embiid playing tonight vs Celtics? Latest 76ers injury update
description: Joel Embiid is set to play for the Philadelphia 76ers against the Boston Celtics in their NBA Cup opener on October 31, 2025. Despite managing knee issues with a 20-minute restriction, his return provides a significant boost. The Sixers aim to maintain their perfect start and gain an early edge in the tournament.

title: Cherries on top: the Iraola effect at Bournemouth
description: The 43-year-old manager has the south coast club punching well above its weight in the English first division. With a disruptive, hard-running, high-pressing style, Iraola’s Bournemouth has started the Premier League season strongly and is proving a serious threat for the big teams

title: Does the Cape Verde fairytale have lessons for Indian football?
description: The archipelagic state in the Atlantic Ocean, off the western coast of Africa, recently became the second-smallest nation, by population, to qualify for the FIFA World Cup. Just how did it script one of sport’s great underdog stories? And can India take a leaf out of its playbook?

title: UIDAI announces change in Aadhaar rules from November 1; here's what has changed
description: Effective November 1, 2025, Aadhaar updates for name, address, and mobile number can be initiated online via the myAadhaar portal, eliminating the need for in-person visits for many demographic changes. Biometric updates still require a visit to an Aadhaar Seva Kendra. The UIDAI has also revised fee structures and emphasized timely PAN-Aadhaar linkage.

description: Tejashwi Prasad Yadav, INDIA bloc's CM candidate, vows to make Bihar number one by focusing on employment, education, healthcare and industrial growth. USCIS ends cheque, money orders: What new debit rule means for H-1B and F-1 applicants
description: USCIS has discontinued cheque and money order payments for immigration filings, mandating electronic debit via Form G-1650 for most applicants. This aims to enhance safety and efficiency, though it may pose challenges for international students and those without US bank accounts. Credit card payments remain an option for H-1B and other employer-sponsored visas.

Leon Draisaitl slams referees over Mika Zibanejad’s controversial penalty
description: Leon Draisaitl expressed frustration with a controversial officiating call that resulted in a minor penalty for a high stick, which he felt should have been a double minor. Despite the disputed call, Draisaitl also acknowledged the Oilers' own issues with turnovers and puck management contributing to their overtime loss to the Rangers.

title: Tannishtha Chatterjee diagnosed with stage 4 cancer: Signs, risks & treatment
description: Bollywood actor Tannishtha Chatterjee revealed her Stage 4 oligometastatic cancer diagnosis, a lesser-known advanced form where cancer spreads to a limited number of sites. This condition, potentially more treatable than widespread metastasis, offers hope for longer survival. Early detection and individualized treatment, including local therapies and systemic approaches, are crucial for managing this evolving disease.

title: Amazon cuts 14,000 jobs: CEO Andy Jassy breaks silence; what he said
description: Amazon CEO Andy Jassy revealed that the recent layoff of 14,000 employees isn't due to financial woes or AI, but rather a cultural shift. He explained that rapid growth led to increased layers and diluted ownership, slowing down operations. This contrasts with other executive statements emphasizing AI's transformative role and the need for leaner structures.

title: Blake Lively’s woes deepen amid Justin Baldoni case as Taylor Swift cuts ties
description: Blake Lively is reportedly facing a deepening legal battle with her "It Ends With Us" co-star Justin Baldoni, as his former agent accused her of "extortion."  Adding to her troubles, Lively's friendship with Taylor Swift has reportedly ended, leaving her concerned about career repercussions and her husband's reputation.
